medical_history.chief_complaint: Early onset of apocrine body odor and pubic hair in a 5-year-old girl.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: The patient was evaluated for apocrine body odor at age 5 4/12 years and exhibited growth along the 75th percentile for height. There was an increase in growth velocity to 3.2 cm over 4 months. By age 10 9/12 years, pubic hair was noted at Tanner stage III-IV with menarche occurring soon afterward.
medical_history.past_medical_history: The patient was born full-term, weighing 7 pounds with a normal newborn screen for congenital adrenal hyperplasia. Previous growth patterns included consistently plotting in the 50th-75th percentiles for weight.
medical_history.family_history: Father had severe acne and developed frontal balding at age 30; mother experienced menarche at age 12 6/12 years. The patient has a 12-year-old sister who has just reached menarche.
medical_history.social_history: The patient has no noted exposure to lice treatments, lavender oil, estrogen sprays or creams, or increased intake of soy. No relevant lifestyle factors are specified.
